newsitem.title: USA: Microsoft plans beta of Internet Studio.
newsitem.headline: Microsoft plans beta of Internet Studio.

text.p: Microsoft Corp said it would make available a beta test version of its Web application development tool code-named "Internet Studio" by the end of the year.
An alpha version was distributed to more than 2,000 attendees at a Microsoft conference, the company said.
The product will be released commercially sometime next year, Microsoft said. Pricing has not yet been announced.

The product, previously developed for the Microsoft Network online service and code-named "Blackbird," was completely revamped last year when Microsoft announced plans to shift its focus to the Internet rather than proprietary standards.
